title: M7: Byte-pair encoding
authorComments: * DIFFICULTY: advanced. * SUPERVISION: teacher-guided. * ESTIMATED ANSWERING TIME: 30 minutes. * LANGUAGE-SPECIFIC CONTENT: English. * ADAPTATION TO OTHER LANGUAGES: understanding the sentence is not relevant here, but the sentences could be translated so that similar results are obtained. * COMMENTS FOR INSTRUCTORS: students should probably be guided step by step to get the vocabulary and splitting of the test sentence. The initial vocabulary will be made up of: t, h, e, c, a, i, s, o, n, h. The most frequent group of two symbols is now t+h (tied with h+e and a+t; ties are broken at random), so th is added to the vocabulary, then th+e and then a+t. The resulting vocabulary is: t, h, e, c, a, i, s, o, n, h, th, the, at. The sentence "the cats are meowing" will be splitted as: the c at s a r/unknown e m/unknown e o w/unknown i n g/unknown.
